p.seg:
This fragmentary inscription found at Razvadje in Croatia attests to a boundary dispute between two parties whose names are lost. The dispute was settled by a board of at least three centurions drawn from two separate legions who had been appointed as iudices by the provincial governor. The placement of the phrase ex [c]omventione would seem to indicate that the parties to the dispute had agreed upon the appointment of the iudices. Compare to Instance
8 (Elliott 2004) .
